intro: Callista mundula, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It has hairy, lobed leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Callista mundula is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
